meanings.definition: To make rural in character or quality.
meanings.sent1: The city dwellers decided to ruralise their backyard by planting a vegetable garden.
meanings.sent2: The artist ruralised the painting by adding a peaceful countryside scene.
meanings.sent3: The urban office building suddenly ruralised when a group of chickens wandered in.
meanings.sent4: Her modern apartment was ruralised into a cozy cottage with rustic decor.
meanings.sent5: The once bustling street was ruralised with the sound of chirping birds and rustling leaves.

meanings.definition: To convert into a rural area.
meanings.sent1: The developers ruralised the land by building farms and barns.
meanings.sent2: The industrial site was ruralised into a serene countryside retreat.
meanings.sent3: The bustling city was ruralised overnight, much to the confusion of its residents.
meanings.sent4: The busy highway was ruralised into a peaceful country road by the overgrown grass.
meanings.sent5: The once lively town square was ruralised into a quiet village with a single bakery.
